ko: 몇 분 있으면 잇몸에 감각이 없어질 거예요.

en: I'll be with you in a few minutes.
A few years ago, our room had little furniture in it.
ko: 몇 년 전만 해도 우리 방엔 가구가 거의 없었어요.

en: I want to extend my stay here for a few more days.
I saw him at the station a few days ago.
You'd better stay in bed for a few days.
ko: 며칠 동안은 누워서 좀 쉬는 게 좋겠어요.

en: Please take a rest for a few days.
A few days' rest will do you good.
ko: 며칠 쉬고 나면 좀 나아질 거예요.

en: It'll pass in a few days.
It is hard to see the sights of Tokyo in a few days.
ko: 며칠 만에 도쿄 관광을 다 하는 건 무리예요.

en: It was not until a few days later that he arrived.
It was not until a few days later that the news arrived.
He stayed there a couple of days.
He will be back in a few days.
The blossoms will be out in a few days.
You'll be all right again in a couple of days.
I wonder if you would mind lending me your car for a couple of days.
ko: 며칠만 차 좀 빌려주실 수 있을까요?

en: Call me every few days, and in that way we can keep in touch if something happens.
ko: 며칠에 한 번씩 전화해 주세요. 그래야 무슨 일 생겨도 연락이 닿죠.

en: I've been there a couple of times.
A few students were left behind.
The leaves will turn red in two or three weeks.
ko: 이삼 주 뒤면 단풍이 들 거예요.

en: May I ask a few questions?
You'll have bleeding for a few hours.
ko: 몇 시간 동안은 피가 날 거예요.

en: Can you pick out a few good books to read?
ko: 읽을 만한 좋은 책 몇 권만 골라줄래요?

en: Apart from a few minor mistakes, your composition was excellent.
ko: 사소한 실수 몇 개만 빼면 작문 정말 훌륭했어요.

en: Except for a few mistakes, his composition is perfect.
ko: 실수 몇 개 빼고는 그 사람 작문은 완벽해요.

en: Apart from a few faults, he is a trustworthy partner.
ko: 단점 몇 가지만 빼면 그는 믿음직한 파트너예요.

en: A few months later they return to their breeding grounds in the Arctic.
ko: 몇 달 뒤에 북극 번식지로 돌아가요.

en: With first base open, he walked the batter.
Can you exchange a 10000 yen note into 50 pence coins?
ko: 만 엔 지폐를 50펜스 동전으로 바꿀 수 있을까요?

en: Can you break a 10000 yen bill?
ko: 만 엔짜리 좀 거슬러 주실 수 있어요?

en: It will cost more than ten thousand yen.
Ten thousand yen will not cover the expenses.
Will ten thousand yen do?
You need great endurance to run ten thousand meters.
ko: 만 미터를 달리려면 엄청난 인내심이 필요해요.

en: A fallen leaf floated on the surface of the water.
ko: 낙엽 하나가 물 위에 떠 있었어요.

en: A dead leaf fell to the ground.
The output power of a one square meter solar panel is about one watt, so it is difficult to use solar power on a large scale at present.
ko: 태양광 패널 1제곱미터 출력량이 1와트 정도라 지금 대규모로 쓰기엔 좀 어려워요.

en: I had scarcely walked a minute before I met him.
ko: 걷기 시작한 지 1분도 안 돼서 그를 만났어요.

en: He missed the train by a minute.
I had hardly waited a minute when he came.
ko: 기다린 지 1분도 안 돼서 그가 왔어요.

en: We can ill afford to lose a minute.
Because just one minute costs nearly four pounds.
It's only six pence per second.
The house was empty except for a cat.
ko: 고양이 한 마리 말고는 집이 비어 있었어요.

en: A grasshopper and many ants lived in a field.
ko: 들판에 베짱이 한 마리랑 개미 여러 마리가 살았어요.

en: A cat appeared from behind the curtain.
ko: 커튼 뒤에서 고양이 한 마리가 나타났어요.

en: A dog is running in the park.
Could you please put me up for the night?
I'd like two singles for three nights from the 21st for about sixty dollars a night.
ko: 21일부터 3박 동안 하룻밤에 60달러 정도 하는 싱글룸 두 개 예약하고 싶어요.

en: We have a single for 50 dollars per night.
I'd like a double for four nights from tonight for about fifty dollars a night.
ko: 오늘부터 4박 동안 하룻밤에 50달러 정도 하는 더블룸 예약하고 싶어요.

en: A cup of hot soup relaxed me.
ko: 따뜻한 수프 한 잔 마시니까 몸이 좀 풀리더라고요.

en: I would rather work for any company than waste another year.
ko: 1년을 더 허비하느니 차라리 아무 회사나 들어가서 일할래요.

en: It is an exciting time of the year.
ko: 지금이 일 년 중 제일 신나는 시기예요.

en: Compared with the level of a year ago, the price is sharply lower.
I wish he could have driven a car a year ago.
ko: 걔가 1년 전부터 운전할 수 있었으면 좋았을 텐데.

en: I have not heard from her for a year.
In the course of a year my son grew stronger.
I'll have you all speaking fluent English within a year.
ko: 1년 안에 다들 영어 유창하게 하게 해줄게.

en: The first season of the year is spring.
The weather changes very often at this time of year.
ko: 일년 중 이맘때면 날씨가 진짜 자주 바뀌어.

en: There are four seasons in a year: spring, summer, fall and winter.
ko: 일년은 봄, 여름, 가을, 겨울 네 계절로 되어 있어.

en: How many seasons are there in a year?
A year has twelve months.
I'll see to it that you have a raise after the first year.
A year had passed by and his body turned to dust.
I was feeling blue all day.
ko: 나 오늘 하루 종일 기분이 꿀꿀했어.

en: I am dead tired from walking around all day.
They were pretty tired after having worked all day.
ko: 하루 종일 일하느라 걔네 꽤 피곤했을 거야.

en: It has kept raining all day.
He was playing tennis all day.
I've been working all day.
I got tired of lying in bed all day.
ko: 하루 종일 누워 있었더니 이제 지겨워.

en: We are gaining a day.
It's impossible to do the sights of Tokyo in a day or two.
ko: 도쿄 구경을 하루 이틀 만에 다 하는 건 불가능해.

en: There is always heavy traffic here at this time of the day.
ko: 이 시간대에는 여기 항상 차가 엄청 막혀.

en: How many cruises are there each day?
Please be sure to take one dose three times a day.
ko: 이거 꼭 하루에 세 번씩 챙겨 먹어.

en: Take the medicine three times a day.
ko: 이 약 하루에 세 번 먹어.

en: I cover twenty miles a day.
It is next to impossible to see Rome in a day.
ko: 로마를 하루 만에 다 보는 건 거의 불가능해.

en: Do you have any day tours?
ko: 일일 투어 상품 같은 거 있어?

en: We have more apples than we could eat in a day.
ko: 사과가 너무 많아서 하루 만에 다 못 먹어.

en: At the end of every day, his back was tired and his legs hurt.
ko: 하루가 끝나면 걔는 항상 허리도 뻐근하고 다리도 아파했어.

en: I go shopping every other day.
ko: 나 이틀에 한 번씩 쇼핑하러 가.

en: Be sure to take medicine three times a day.
ko: 약 꼭 하루에 세 번씩 챙겨 먹어.

en: An elephant was hunted there.
Do you think you can live on a dollar a day in America?
ko: 미국에서 하루 1달러로 살 수 있을 것 같아?

en: It was Janet that won first prize.
A monster lay on a rock near the top of the mountain.
ko: 산 정상 근처 바위에 괴물 한 마리가 누워 있었어.

en: I've won first prize!
Little did she dream that she could win first prize.
ko: 자기가 1등 할 줄은 꿈에도 몰랐을 거야.

en: Never did I dream of winning first prize.
ko: 내가 1등 할 거라고는 꿈에도 생각 못 했어.

en: Everybody fails once or twice.
There is but one chance left.
I must buy one.
A car stopped at the entrance.
A truck was careering along the road.
ko: 트럭 한 대가 도로를 쌩쌩 달리고 있었어.

en: A pair of gloves was left in the taxi.
ko: 택시에 장갑 한 켤레가 떨어져 있었어.

en: He makes a religion of never wasting a penny.
ko: 걔는 돈 한 푼도 허투루 안 쓰는 걸 철칙으로 삼아.

en: Ten million yen will be ample for the project.
ko: 천만 엔이면 그 프로젝트에 충분할 거야.

en: A century is one hundred years.
A boy was walking with his hands in his pockets.
ko: 한 소년이 주머니에 손을 넣고 걷고 있었어.

en: One lives in Fukuoka, and the others live in Niigata.
ko: 한 명은 후쿠오카에 살고, 나머지는 니가타에 살아.

en: One is Japanese and the other is Italian.
ko: 한 명은 일본 사람이고 다른 한 명은 이탈리아 사람이야.

en: One is in Kumamoto and the other in Tokyo.
ko: 하나는 구마모토에 있고 다른 하나는 도쿄에 있어.
